intro: Tigridia citrina, commonly known as the yellow tiger flower, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to Mexico. It is a perennial herb with tuberous roots and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in spring and are characterized by their vibrant color and distinctive markings. Tigridia citrina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
